skill.name: tests-maintenance
skill.description: Maintains IdeaVim test suite quality. Reviews disabled tests, ensures Neovim annotations are documented, and improves test readability. Use for periodic test maintenance.

skill.author: JetBrains

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate test maintenance skill from JetBrains for the IdeaVim project. All 74 static findings are false positives: SHA-256 hash identifiers in metadata were misidentified as cryptographic algorithms, markdown code blocks and documentation tables were misidentified as shell execution, and standard dev commands were misidentified as reconnaissance. The skill only provides guidance for test quality review and does not execute code automatically.

content.user_title: Review and maintain test suite quality
content.value_statement: Test suites accumulate technical debt over time. Disabled tests lose context, Neovim exclusions lack documentation, and test content becomes meaningless. This skill helps maintainers systematically review disabled tests, document exclusion reasons, and improve test readability.
actual_capabilities: Find and review disabled tests in test files
Run gradle tests to verify test status
limitations: Does not fix bugs in production code
Does not run full test suites

use_cases.title: Review disabled tests
use_cases.description: Find and evaluate disabled tests to determine if they can be re-enabled or should be removed.

use_cases.title: Document Neovim exclusions
use_cases.description: Review @TestWithoutNeovim annotations and ensure each exclusion has clear documentation.

use_cases.title: Improve test readability
use_cases.description: Identify and replace meaningless test content with realistic code snippets.

prompt_templates.title: Find disabled tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all disabled tests in the IdeaVim project. Use grep to search for @Disabled annotations in test files. List each test class and method along with its disabled reason.

prompt_templates.title: Review Neovim exclusions
prompt_templates.prompt: Review all @TestWithoutNeovim annotations. Identify any that are missing the description parameter. Check if the exclusion reason is still valid.

prompt_templates.title: Improve test content
prompt_templates.prompt: Search test files for meaningless content patterns like 'asdf', 'qwerty', or random strings. Replace them with realistic code snippets relevant to each test.

prompt_templates.title: Run full maintenance
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete test maintenance review: find disabled tests, verify Neovim exclusions are documented, check test content readability, and run tests to confirm status.

output_examples.input: Find disabled tests in the IdeaVim project
output: - DeleteMotionTest.testDeleteLine: Disabled due to caret positioning bug (#1234)
Recommendation: Run DeleteMotionTest to verify if the fix in commit abc123 resolved the issue.
- ScrollTest.testScrollDown: Uses UNCLEAR reason but no description
- CommandTest.testShowCmd: Uses SHOW_CMD reason, needs YouTrack link
- PluginTest.testSurround: Uses PLUGIN reason, description is adequate
Actions needed: Add descriptions to 2 annotations, verify 1 reason is still valid
Found 2 test files with meaningless content:
- ChangeActionTest: Contains 'asdfgh' placeholder text in 3 test methods
- MotionTest: Contains 'qwerty' strings in setup methods
Replace with: Realistic code snippets from CONTRIBUTING.md guidelines

best_practices: Document why each test is disabled with clear explanation
Verify disabled tests by running them before re-enabling
Replace meaningless test strings with realistic code examples
anti_patterns: Assuming disabled tests will be fixed later without tracking
Focusing only on documentation without verifying test status

faq.question: What IDEs and tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Claude Code, and Codex. It is designed for JetBrains IDEs using the IdeaVim plugin.

faq.question: How many tests can this skill review at once?
faq.answer: The skill focuses on small subsets per run. It suggests using random selection or targeting specific test directories.

faq.question: Does this skill modify production code?
faq.answer: No. The skill is explicitly scoped to test files only and does not fix bugs or implement features in source code.

faq.question: Is my test data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only reads test files within your repository and runs tests locally. No data is sent externally.

faq.question: What if a disabled test fails when I run it?
faq.answer: The skill will report the failure and recommend documenting the reason in the @Disabled annotation if not already present.

faq.question: How is this different from a general test review tool?
faq.answer: This skill is specialized for IdeaVim and Kotlin tests. It understands Neovim-specific annotations and follows project conventions.
